channel.title: The Internet
channel.description:
Alright, I have noticed a lot of flaming on the internet lately (not just this forum, but others also). Flaming on the internet never did anything beneficial for society or the human race. I also really dislike the very high usage of incoherent sentences and phrases (and spam) being used on the internet. I honestly think that these behaviors influence new ones to a community (I.E. Noobs). If you people don't get your act together and try to be a good influence for others to follow, then this world is just going to go to pieces (well...more so then now). A community of rule breakers is no community at all. I especially recommend everyone to try keep these rules in the back of your mind before posting a new reply:
Rule 1: We are not anti-leech. If you respect our community and our ideas, feel free to ask questions and they will be kindly answered if you follow other rules. [B]Answer to questions that others ask if you know the answer or remain silent![/B] Rule 3: We don't make spelling mistakes on purpose. We use "you" not "u", we use "why" not "y" etc. [B]We don't make posts that contain not useful information.[/B] Posts like "cool", "lol", "yeah" and "I agree" don't contain anything useful for others. We are not fans of off topic, unless it contains something smart or funny. Most of things spammers find funny are actually not funny at all. Rule 6: [B]We respect each other and other communities. We don't flame each other or other communities. We don't fight on the forums.[/B]
If you are lacking in your ability to string together or comprehend sentences that are effective in communicating using written (or typed) words or text, then please at least try. I understand for people whose first language is not English, but for those that have been using English all your life, higher expectations are in order. Thank you and you may be on your way now. Regards, -Kilos

item.title: The Internet
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Making this thread is basically asking the people who normally do this to come and flame/spam. Heh, maybe it’s a case of reverse pschology.
Don’t push this button! Hmm… pushes it

Sometimes it’s funny, but it’s annoying when it gets out of hand. Course you also need to remember that the forum is filled with 12 year olds.

Read full topic

item.title: The Internet
item.dc:creator: @Mopar_Helper Mopar Helper
item.description:
@Mopar_Helper wrote:

I Agree about reading rules and that, but if someone said to you ‘go to moparisthebest.com/smf its cool’ they wouldnt learn it straight away and would start saying stuff like ‘how do i make a server’ and i think there should be a section for that with noob guides like ‘how to get servers’ etc.[quote=“popcorn89, post:22, topic:90006”][quote author=Mopar Helper link=topic=131515.msg1276891#msg1276891 date=1178498051]on moparisthebest.com/smf, when new people join and dont know what they’re doing and post something random, normally someone would go ‘omfg, gtfo of the forums noob!’ which is pretty sad…[/quote]
But at the same time they deserve it for not being able to read.[/quote]

Flaming on the internet never did anything beneficial for society or the human race. I also really dislike the very high usage of incoherent sentences and phrases (and spam) being used on the internet. I honestly think that these behaviors influence new ones to a community (I.E. Noobs). If you people don’t get your act together and try to be a good influence for others to follow, then this world is just going to go to pieces (well…more so then now).

A community of rule breakers is no community at all. I especially recommend everyone to try keep these rules in the back of your mind before posting a new reply: [quote=Moparisthebest.com Rules]
Rule 1:
We are not anti-leech. If you respect our community and our ideas, feel free to ask questions and they will be kindly answered if you follow other rules. Answer to questions that others ask if you know the answer or remain silent!

Rule 3:
We don’t make spelling mistakes on purpose. We use “you” not “u”, we use “why” not “y” etc.

We don’t make posts that contain not useful information. Posts like “cool”, “lol”, “yeah” and “I agree” don’t contain anything useful for others. We are not fans of off topic, unless it contains something smart or funny. Most of things spammers find funny are actually not funny at all.

Rule 6:
We respect each other and other communities. We don’t flame each other or other communities. We don’t fight on the forums.

[/quote]

If you are lacking in your ability to string together or comprehend sentences that are effective in communicating using written (or typed) words or text, then please at least try. I understand for people whose first language is not English, but for those that have been using English all your life, higher expectations are in order. Thank you and you may be on your way now.

Regards,
-Kilos[/quote]
Yeh, i hate flaming, especially when it offends you or is directing at you.
worst thing i hate is racist people…
going ‘you nigga’ or something, makes me very angry…
Flaming directed at over people i hate, cause i think the person must feel so bad inside…
on moparisthebest.com/smf, when new people join and dont know what they’re doing and post something random, normally someone would go ‘omfg, gtfo of the forums noob!’ which is pretty sad…
And i think that flaming is really pointless unless they have done something to you really bad…

[quote=“Dell451, post:3, topic:90006”]The Internet is for PXrn, idiot!!!

Jking, I noticed that too, and it really ticks me off, because if there is one thing worse then spammmers, it’s flammers, and not the fast-food sangwichs.

Yes, Sangwichs…Ummmmm… :|[br][size=1]Posted on: May 05, 2007, 21:51:00[/size][hr][quote author=lawl link=topic=131515.msg1272844#msg1272844 date=1178437802]

Wow.
[/quote]WORLD OF WARCRAFT HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THIS THREAD
STAY ON TOPIC PLEASE

I hope your jking…[/quote]
Notice the ‘I Hope your jking…’?
Here we go again… And notice that was a double post?

[quote=“Dell451, post:6, topic:90006”][quote author=lawl link=topic=131515.msg1272844#msg1272844 date=1178437802]

Wow.
[/quote]WORLD OF WARCRAFT HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THIS THREAD
STAY ON TOPIC PLEASE

I hope your jking…[/quote]
Hmm? Again? 2 Posts Later?
Isnt thaqt just complete spam…

Read full topic

You don’t understand that this forum is pretty relaxed. The flaming that happens here is funny, and most of the time, they deserve it. Do, stfu, telling us the rules, as most of us agreed to them when we signed up. We already know that serious flaming will resort in a warning. So, yes, stfu.

item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

Alright, I have noticed a lot of flaming on the internet lately (not just this forum, but others also). Flaming on the internet never did anything beneficial for society or the human race. I also really dislike the very high usage of incoherent sentences and phrases (and spam) being used on the internet. I honestly think that these behaviors influence new ones to a community (I.E. Noobs). If you people don’t get your act together and try to be a good influence for others to follow, then this world is just going to go to pieces (well…more so then now).

A community of rule breakers is no community at all. I especially recommend everyone to try keep these rules in the back of your mind before posting a new reply:

Rule 1:
We are not anti-leech. If you respect our community and our ideas, feel free to ask questions and they will be kindly answered if you follow other rules. Answer to questions that others ask if you know the answer or remain silent!

Rule 3:
We don’t make spelling mistakes on purpose. We use “you” not “u”, we use “why” not “y” etc.

We don’t make posts that contain not useful information. Posts like “cool”, “lol”, “yeah” and “I agree” don’t contain anything useful for others. We are not fans of off topic, unless it contains something smart or funny. Most of things spammers find funny are actually not funny at all.

Rule 6:
We respect each other and other communities. We don’t flame each other or other communities. We don’t fight on the forums.

If you are lacking in your ability to string together or comprehend sentences that are effective in communicating using written (or typed) words or text, then please at least try. I understand for people whose first language is not English, but for those that have been using English all your life, higher expectations are in order. Thank you and you may be on your way now.

Regards,
-Kilos
